Uses of Class
qahramon.Item

  • Packages that use Item 
    Package Description
    qahramon  
    qahramon.exceptions  

    • Uses of Item in qahramon

      Subclasses of Item in qahramon 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Armor
      A class of armors as special kinds of items involving a protection and full protection.
      class  Backpack
      A class of backpacks as special kinds of items involving a capacity and content.
      class  Purse
      A class of purses as special kinds of items involving capacity, content and isTorn.
      class  Weapon
      A class of weapons as special kinds of items involving damage.
      Methods in qahramon that return Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Item Character.getItemAt(int anchorId)
      Return the item at the given anchorId.
      Methods in qahramon that return types with arguments of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<Item> Character.getAnchoredItems()
      Return a set with all items anchors attached.
      java.util.Set<Item> Backpack.getItems()
      Return a set with all the items of this backpack.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Backpack.canHaveAsItem(Item item)
      Check whether this backpack can have an item.
      boolean Character.canHaveAsItemAt(int anchorId, Item item)
      Check whether the given item can be equipped in the given slot.
      boolean Hero.canHaveAsItemAt(int anchorId, Item item)

      Pick up the item when this character wants to take it.

      Equip an item in the given anchor.
      void Character.equip(int anchorId, Item item)
      Equip item from own inventory or from ground, on the given slot.
      void Character.giveTo(Item item, Character character)
      Try to give an item to the given character.
      boolean Character.hasAnchored(Item item)
      Check whether this character has the given item anchored.
      void Character.pickUp(Item item)
      Pick up an item from a dead body or from the ground.
      boolean Monster.wantsToTake(Item item)
      Check whether the monster wants to take the given item.
      abstract boolean Character.wantsToTake(Item item)
      Check whether the character wants to take this item.
      boolean Hero.wantsToTake(Item item)

      Constructor parameters in qahramon with type arguments of type Item 
      Constructor and Description
      Hero(java.lang.String name, int hitpoints, float strength, java.util.HashMap<AnchorType,Item> items)
      Create a hero with a given name, amount of hitpoints, strength and gear.
      Monster(java.lang.String name, int hitpoints, int damage, int protection, int numberOfAnchors, float capacity, java.util.HashSet<Item> items)
      Create a monster with a given name, amount of hitpoints, damage, protection, number of anchors, capacity and given items, which are randomly distributed on the anchors.
